quiz.title: Threat Detection Concepts Assessment
quiz.description: Test your understanding of the Pyramid of Pain and related concepts

questions.question: Which level of the Pyramid of Pain represents the most difficult indicators for adversaries to change?
questions.explanation: TTPs (Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures) represent the highest level of the pyramid and are the most difficult for adversaries to change, as they require fundamentally altering their methodology.

questions.question: Why are Hash Values considered 'Trivial' in the Pyramid of Pain?
options: They are not important for detection
They are easy for attackers to modify
They require special tools to generate
questions.explanation: Hash Values are considered trivial because attackers can easily modify them by making minor changes to their files, making them unreliable as long-term indicators.

questions.question: Which detection method is most effective for identifying adversary TTPs?
questions.explanation: Behavior analytics is most effective for identifying TTPs as it focuses on patterns of behavior rather than specific indicators, making it harder for adversaries to evade detection.
